content: Gay combat veteran to challenge Garamendi for Congressional seat It's hard to say whether John Garamendi saw this one coming, or if he did, if he took it seriously. Perhaps there is nothing to worry about for the career politician with strong name recognition, who announced last week he would forgo his desire to run for governor and instead run for the open seat on the House of Representatives, vacated by Rep. Ellen Tauscher, who is joining the Obama administration. But if Garamendi didn't take Anthony Woods seriously, he should have. Anthony Woods, the latest candidate to announce his intention to run for Tauchser's seat, is one serious guy. Woods campaign Web site makes clear in a couple of pictures what he is all about, a decorated graduate of West Point who won the Bronze Star during two tours of duty in Iraq, who is an active community servant, involved in organizations like Habitat for Humanity. Woods strong resume shows how much he has packed into his life so far. Still shy of his 30th birthday, Woods has put together a Hallmark movie story. Despite growing up with a single mother, Woods attended West Point. He earned a master's degree from Harvard. Despite his combat acclaim in two tours of duty, he was dismissed from the military when he broke the "don't ask, don't tell," policy and announced he was gay. I just got tired of living a lie," he told Capitol Alert last weekend. "I spent four years at West Point living and breathing the Honor Code. So I made the decision to tell my commander." Read the full story at >>> >>>http://www.examiner.com/x-4106-California-Statehouse-Examiner~y2009m4d28-Gay-combat-veteran-to-challenge-Garamendi-for-Congressional-seat

title: Gay combat veteran to challenge Garamendi for Congressional seat

content: Curious. What state? locality? Sounds fantastic. I've always thought gays and lesbians should work hard at maintaining a visible and respectful presence as members of the military, the civil service, church boards, etc. Hell, if you've got kids, join the PTA. One or two token gays can't do ALL the heavy lifting.
reply: Curious. What state? locality? Sounds fantastic. content: I beleive he is from California, the SF Bay Area specifically, which is where im from. Hopefully I'll get to cast my vote for him.

content: I like him just from reading this forum. It would be great if more with his history and craving would fight the good fight in politics. We certainly need more soldiers like him. Wish I could vote for him.
